name: Toolbox
headline: Financial operating system for SMBs
description: Our mission at Toolbox is to help SMBs thrive by providing them with a simple, yet powerful financial operating system to grow their business.

founders.name: Wil Eyi, Founder
founders.description:
From 🇬🇦. Formerly @ Goldman Sachs, @ Warburg Pincus
Passionate about financial inclusion and Sub-Saharan Africa

generated_description:
Toolbox is a fintech startup with a mission: to help small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) thrive by offering a simplified yet powerful financial operating system. Founded in 2019 and based in New York, Toolbox is a part of the Y Combinator Batch S20 and has a compact team of just seven members.

The company is built around the idea that managing finances shouldn't be a hassle for business owners. Toolbox offers a range of services including corporate cards, cash management, and smart spend management—all designed to drive efficiency while saving money. They emphasize zero software fees, with some users able to earn up to 1.3% cash back on debit card spends. That's right; they actively encourage saving as you spend!

Their flagship offerings include flexible lines of credit, allowing businesses to access substantial funds without the burden of unnecessary fees. If you’re an established business with over $1 million in revenue, you might also qualify for Toolbox's corporate charge card, enabling you to free up cash flow significantly.

At Toolbox, they pride themselves on quick personalized onboarding sessions to get businesses set up and running with their financial tools—all on the same day. Their promise? More savings with less effort.

What’s the takeaway? Toolbox isn’t just about providing financial tools; it’s about engineering a comprehensive financial ecosystem for SMBs that streamlines operations, enhances cash flow, and ultimately helps businesses grow. If you’re looking for a smarter way to manage your operating cash, Toolbox might just be the solution you didn’t realize you needed.

Check them out at [trytoolbox.com](https://www.trytoolbox.com).
